meanings.definition: To give a title or right to something.
meanings.sent1: She intitles the book with a creative name.
meanings.sent2: The certificate intitles you to a free meal at the restaurant.
meanings.sent3: His joke intitles him to the 'funniest person' award.
meanings.sent4: The key intitles you to unlock the hidden treasure.
meanings.sent5: The special ticket intitles the holder to front-row seats at the concert.

meanings.sent1: Winning the contest intitles her to a prize.
meanings.sent2: Completing the course intitles you to a certificate.
meanings.sent3: His good behavior intitles him to extra playtime.
meanings.sent4: Hard work intitles you to success in the long run.
meanings.sent5: The ticket intitles the bearer to a backstage pass.

meanings.definition: To provide a title for a work of art or literature.
meanings.sent1: The author intitles her new novel 'The Mystery of the Missing Key'.
meanings.sent2: The artist intitles the painting 'Sunset Serenity'.
meanings.sent3: The poet intitles his latest poem 'Whispers of the Wind'.
meanings.sent4: The director intitles the film 'Journey to the Unknown'.
meanings.sent5: The playwright intitles the play 'Echoes of the Past'.
